to Amr

Confidential

From: Michael Hoffman <<redacted.email>>
Date: Tue, Aug 12, 2025 at 12:13 PM
Subject: Re: Charlotte SIP Chapel – Update & Proposal Request
To: Ricky Rayborn <<redacted.email>>


Hi Ricky, 
This is great!  Working on the reply and will have soon.  

Regarding aesthetics.  The flying buttress structure rhymes with big Cathedrals and looks beautiful.  (and expensive). They look integral to the architect's vision.  I don't have structural drawings, so I may be misinterpreting design intent. 

Claude Sonnet the AI says: "Modern materials and engineering also give you many more cost-effective options - steel frame construction, engineered timber trusses, reinforced concrete, or even traditional masonry with internal buttressing if you want that Gothic feel. You could achieve beautiful vaulted ceilings and Gothic aesthetics without the complexity and expense of true flying buttresses.
If you're drawn to that Gothic visual language, you might consider decorative elements that evoke the style - pointed arch windows, ribbed vaulting details, or even faux buttresses that are purely aesthetic rather than structural. You'd get the beauty without the massive structural engineering costs"

Perhaps I am misinterpreting the renderings and drawings. Please let me know.  

Cheers, 
Michael Hoffman
<redacted.phone>
